title: How to Make Champagne Sorbet

steps.headline: Open the champagne 2 hours in advance of the other steps and pour it slowly into a large mixing bowl.
Squeeze enough juice from the fresh fruit.
steps.description: You'll need 1 cup of grapefruit juice and 1/3 cup of lemon juice. Don't remove the pulp.

steps.headline: Combine 1 cup water and 1 cup granulated sugar in a medium saucepan.
Heat the mixture over medium heat.
steps.description: Stir it until it reaches a boil and the sugar completely dissolves.

steps.headline: Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 5 minutes.
Turn off the stove and remove the pan from the burner.
Put the lid on the saucepan and allow it to cool for 10 minutes.
Pour the sugar syrup into the champagne.
steps.description: Add the freshly squeezed grapefruit juice and lemon juice, and then stir until blended.

steps.headline: Freeze the champagne sorbet with an ice cream maker or just in the freezer.
steps.description: With an ice cream maker, pour the mixture in and follow the manufacturer's instructions. To just use the freezer, pour the mixture into a covered container and place it into the freezer. After it turns into a slush, mash it with a fork before returning it to the freezer. Once it's completely frozen, transfer it to a blender or food processor and process until smooth. Pour it back to the covered container and replace in the freezer until you are ready to serve it.

text: Open the champagne 2 hours in advance of the other steps and pour it slowly into a large mixing bowl.  Squeeze enough juice from the fresh fruit. You'll need 1 cup of grapefruit juice and 1/3 cup of lemon juice. Don't remove the pulp. Combine 1 cup water and 1 cup granulated sugar in a medium saucepan.  Heat the mixture over medium heat. Stir it until it reaches a boil and the sugar completely dissolves. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 5 minutes.  Turn off the stove and remove the pan from the burner.  Put the lid on the saucepan and allow it to cool for 10 minutes.  Pour the sugar syrup into the champagne. Add the freshly squeezed grapefruit juice and lemon juice, and then stir until blended. Freeze the champagne sorbet with an ice cream maker or just in the freezer. With an ice cream maker, pour the mixture in and follow the manufacturer's instructions. To just use the freezer, pour the mixture into a covered container and place it into the freezer. After it turns into a slush, mash it with a fork before returning it to the freezer. Once it's completely frozen, transfer it to a blender or food processor and process until smooth. Pour it back to the covered container and replace in the freezer until you are ready to serve it.
